Award.AwardTitle: Scholarship, Leadership, and Mentoring in the STEM Fields (SLMS)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
The Scholarship, Leadership, and Mentoring in the STEM Fields (SLMS) project at Tougaloo College is supporting 15 students with 4-year scholarships as they earn degrees in science, computer science, or mathematics. To augment traditional studies, the SLMS program also is focusing on leadership training in addition to community building. SLMS scholars are benefiting from individual mentoring from a faculty team of two and from targeted academic support through the college's Science Success Center. In addition, SLMS scholars are being given opportunities for internships with workforce partners as well as research opportunities with on-campus faculty. SLMS scholars are being invited to take advantage of intensive career counseling in addition to leadership skill-building workshops and seminars. Scholars are participating in the ACTIVE seminar series in which they are building their scientific writing and presentation skills while also interfacing with the invited distinguished faculty visitors.

Intellectual Merit: The SLMS program is removing one of the major hindrances concerning minority student success in STEM disciplines, namely financial need. With a revamped curriculum, Tougaloo is positioned to increase STEM student engagement and build hands-on investigative and critical thinking skills. This program is providing data on the impact of financial support on recruitment and retention-to-degree of African-American students at a small private HBCU .

Broader Impact: The project is building on a strong base to provide everything a student needs to attend college and to succeed as a major in a STEM area. Academic enrichment, professional development, and a hands-on approach to mentoring are at the core of this program that is graduating well-rounded, scientifically literate, community-committed, minority students who are increasing the diversity in the STEM workforce.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Scholarship, Leadership, and Mentoring in the STEM Fields (SLMS) Outcomes Report

 

 

 

 

The SLMS program implemented activities to accomplish these aims:

 

  T   1. To increase the number of STEM majors at Tougaloo College by awarding scholarships to academically talented students exhibiting financial need

 

2. To develop and deliver effective programming, curricular and professional, that will enable Tougaloo College STEM majors to succeed in a STEM career

3. To provide opportunities to build a community of STEM majors

4.  To enable Scholars to build strong leadership skills

 

         Significant Results

The aims of SLMS were built around the three major themes of Leadership Training, Community Building, Career Development. (1)  Leadership Training encompassed activities associated with goal of ?enabling the Scholars to succeed in a STEM career? through Internships, Membership in professional organizations and Area Clubs, and participation in Leadership Roles.  (2)  Community Building encompassed activities associated with the goal of ?providing opportunities to build a community of majors? by conducting colloquia where professionals in the various STEM disciplines visited the Tougaloo Campus to share their career experiences leading to encouraging the SLMS mentees to choose a science major with the goal of entering graduate school in pursuit of a degree with a major appropriate for a successful career in a STEM discipline.  (3)  Career Development encompassed activities associated with the goal to ?build strong leadership skills? and ?delivering programming the help STEM majors to succeed? through mentoring where the Scholars were assigned to a faculty mentor and engaged in research and made presentations on the findings at conferences and on-campus workshops.
